help: A medical study is an umbrella type covering all kinds of research studies relating to human medicine or health, including observational studies and interventional trials and registries, randomized, controlled or not. When the specific type of study is known, use one of the extensions of this type, such as MedicalTrial or MedicalObservationalStudy. Also, note that this type should be used to mark up data that describes the study itself; to tag an article that publishes the results of a study, use MedicalScholarlyArticle. Note: use the code property of MedicalEntity to store study IDs, e.g. clinicaltrials.gov ID.

name: MovieClip
help: A short segment/part of a movie.

name: LymphaticVessel
help: A type of blood vessel that specifically carries lymph fluid unidirectionally toward the heart.

name: FundingAgency
help:
A FundingAgency is an organization that implements one or more [[FundingScheme]]s and manages
    the granting process (via [[Grant]]s, typically [[MonetaryGrant]]s).
    A funding agency is not always required for grant funding, e.g. philanthropic giving, corporate sponsorship etc.
    
Examples of funding agencies include ERC, REA, NIH, Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation...

name: MortgageLoan
help: A loan in which property or real estate is used as collateral. (A loan securitized against some real estate).

name: SpeakableSpecification
help: A SpeakableSpecification indicates (typically via [[xpath]] or [[cssSelector]]) sections of a document that are highlighted as particularly [[speakable]]. Instances of this type are expected to be used primarily as values of the [[speakable]] property.

name: ServiceChannel
help: A means for accessing a service, e.g. a government office location, web site, or phone number.

name: ImageGallery
help: Web page type: Image gallery page.

name: TypeAndQuantityNode
help: A structured value indicating the quantity, unit of measurement, and business function of goods included in a bundle offer.

name: AdultEntertainment
help: An adult entertainment establishment.

name: MotorcycleRepair
help: A motorcycle repair shop.

name: CommentAction
help: The act of generating a comment about a subject.

name: City
help: A city or town.

name: InternetCafe
help: An internet cafe.

name: Festival
help: Event type: Festival.

name: GeoCoordinates
help: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

name: RepaymentSpecification
help: A structured value representing repayment.

name: Motel
help:
A motel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

name: ReportageNewsArticle
help:
The [[ReportageNewsArticle]] type is a subtype of [[NewsArticle]] representing
 news articles which are the result of journalistic news reporting conventions.

In practice many news publishers produce a wide variety of article types, many of which might be considered a [[NewsArticle]] but not a [[ReportageNewsArticle]]. For example, opinion pieces, reviews, analysis, sponsored or satirical articles, or articles that combine several of these elements.

The [[ReportageNewsArticle]] type is based on a stricter ideal for "news" as a work of journalism, with articles based on factual information either observed or verified by the author, or reported and verified from knowledgeable sources.  This often includes perspectives from multiple viewpoints on a particular issue (distinguishing news reports from public relations or propaganda).  News reports in the [[ReportageNewsArticle]] sense de-emphasize the opinion of the author, with commentary and value judgements typically expressed elsewhere.

A [[ReportageNewsArticle]] which goes deeper into analysis can also be marked with an additional type of [[AnalysisNewsArticle]].

name: EventReservation
help: A reservation for an event like a concert, sporting event, or lecture.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

name: QuoteAction
help: An agent quotes/estimates/appraises an object/product/service with a price at a location/store.

name: PublicationVolume
help: A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or multi-volume work, often numbered. It may represent a time span, such as a year.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

name: RVPark
help: A place offering space for "Recreational Vehicles", Caravans, mobile homes and the like.

name: AgreeAction
help: The act of expressing a consistency of opinion with the object. An agent agrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

name: JewelryStore
help: A jewelry store.

name: Ligament
help: A short band of tough, flexible, fibrous connective tissue that functions to connect multiple bones, cartilages, and structurally support joints.

name: AnimalShelter
help: Animal shelter.

name: SpecialAnnouncement
help:
A SpecialAnnouncement combines a simple date-stamped textual information update
      with contextualized Web links and other structured data.  It represents an information update made by a
      locally-oriented organization, for example schools, pharmacies, healthcare providers,  community groups, police,
      local government.

For work in progress guidelines on Coronavirus-related markup see [this doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/14ikaGCKxo50rRM7nvKSlbUpjyIk2WMQd3IkB1lItlrM/edit#).

The motivating scenario for SpecialAnnouncement is the [Coronavirus pandemic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_coronavirus_pandemic), and the initial vocabulary is oriented to this urgent situation. Schema.org
expect to improve the markup iteratively as it is deployed and as feedback emerges from use. In addition to our
usual [Github entry](https://github.com/schemaorg/schemaorg/issues/2490), feedback comments can also be provided in [this document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fpdFFxk8s87CWwACs53SGkYv3aafSxz_DTtOQxMrBJQ/edit#).


While this schema is designed to communicate urgent crisis-related information, it is not the same as an emergency warning technology like [CAP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_Alerting_Protocol), although there may be overlaps. The intent is to cover
the kinds of everyday practical information being posted to existing websites during an emergency situation.

Several kinds of information can be provided:

We encourage the provision of "name", "text", "datePosted", "expires" (if appropriate), "category" and
"url" as a simple baseline. It is important to provide a value for "category" where possible, most ideally as a well known
URL from Wikipedia or Wikidata. In the case of the 2019-2020 Coronavirus pandemic, this should be "https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2019-20\_coronavirus\_pandemic" or "https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q81068910".

For many of the possible properties, values can either be simple links or an inline description, depending on whether a summary is available. For a link, provide just the URL of the appropriate page as the property's value. For an inline description, use a [[WebContent]] type, and provide the url as a property of that, alongside at least a simple "[[text]]" summary of the page. It is
unlikely that a single SpecialAnnouncement will need all of the possible properties simultaneously.

We expect that in many cases the page referenced might contain more specialized structured data, e.g. contact info, [[openingHours]], [[Event]], [[FAQPage]] etc. By linking to those pages from a [[SpecialAnnouncement]] you can help make it clearer that the events are related to the situation (e.g. Coronavirus) indicated by the [[category]] property of the [[SpecialAnnouncement]].

Many [[SpecialAnnouncement]]s will relate to particular regions and to identifiable local organizations. Use [[spatialCoverage]] for the region, and [[announcementLocation]] to indicate specific [[LocalBusiness]]es and [[CivicStructure]]s. If the announcement affects both a particular region and a specific location (for example, a library closure that serves an entire region), use both [[spatialCoverage]] and [[announcementLocation]].

The [[about]] property can be used to indicate entities that are the focus of the announcement. We now recommend using [[about]] only
for representing non-location entities (e.g. a [[Course]] or a [[RadioStation]]). For places, use [[announcementLocation]] and [[spatialCoverage]]. Consumers of this markup should be aware that the initial design encouraged the use of /about for locations too.

The basic content of [[SpecialAnnouncement]] is similar to that of an [RSS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS) or [Atom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atom_(Web_standard)) feed. For publishers without such feeds, basic feed-like information can be shared by posting
[[SpecialAnnouncement]] updates in a page, e.g. using JSON-LD. For sites with Atom/RSS functionality, you can point to a feed
with the [[webFeed]] property. This can be a simple URL, or an inline [[DataFeed]] object, with [[encodingFormat]] providing
media type information e.g. "application/rss+xml" or "application/atom+xml".

name: ReturnAction
help: The act of returning to the origin that which was previously received (concrete objects) or taken (ownership).

name: Atlas
help: A collection or bound volume of maps, charts, plates or tables, physical or in media form illustrating any subject.

name: MerchantReturnEnumeration
help: Enumerates several kinds of product return policies.

name: Drawing
help: A picture or diagram made with a pencil, pen, or crayon rather than paint.

name: ChemicalSubstance
help: A chemical substance is 'a portion of matter of constant composition, composed of molecular entities of the same type or of different types' (source: [ChEBI:59999](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chebi/searchId.do?chebiId=59999)).

name: Restaurant
help: A restaurant.

name: ProductGroup
help:
A ProductGroup represents a group of [[Product]]s that vary only in certain well-described ways, such as by [[size]], [[color]], [[material]] etc.

While a ProductGroup itself is not directly offered for sale, the various varying products that it represents can be. The ProductGroup serves as a prototype or template, standing in for all of the products who have an [[isVariantOf]] relationship to it. As such, properties (including additional types) can be applied to the ProductGroup to represent characteristics shared by each of the (possibly very many) variants. Properties that reference a ProductGroup are not included in this mechanism; neither are the following specific properties [[variesBy]], [[hasVariant]], [[url]].

name: ShippingDeliveryTime
help: ShippingDeliveryTime provides various pieces of information about delivery times for shipping.

name: Table
help: A table on a Web page.

name: DrugPrescriptionStatus
help: Indicates whether this drug is available by prescription or over-the-counter.

name: CarUsageType
help: A value indicating a special usage of a car, e.g. commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi.

name: BorrowAction
help:
The act of obtaining an object under an agreement to return it at a later date. Reciprocal of LendAction.

Related actions:

* [[LendAction]]: Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

name: ReviewNewsArticle
help: A [[NewsArticle]] and [[CriticReview]] providing a professional critic's assessment of a service, product, performance, or artistic or literary work.

name: HotelRoom
help:
A hotel room is a single room in a hotel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

name: ArchiveOrganization
help: An organization with archival holdings. An organization which keeps and preserves archival material and typically makes it accessible to the public.

name: Claim
help:
A [[Claim]] in Schema.org represents a specific, factually-oriented claim that could be the [[itemReviewed]] in a [[ClaimReview]]. The content of a claim can be summarized with the [[text]] property. Variations on well known claims can have their common identity indicated via [[sameAs]] links, and summarized with a [[name]]. Ideally, a [[Claim]] description includes enough contextual information to minimize the risk of ambiguity or inclarity. In practice, many claims are better understood in the context in which they appear or the interpretations provided by claim reviews.

  Beyond [[ClaimReview]], the Claim type can be associated with related creative works - for example a [[ScholarlyArticle]] or [[Question]] might be [[about]] some [[Claim]].

  At this time, Schema.org does not define any types of relationship between claims. This is a natural area for future exploration.

name: ProgramMembership
help: Used to describe membership in a loyalty programs (e.g. "StarAliance"), traveler clubs (e.g. "AAA"), purchase clubs ("Safeway Club"), etc.

name: PhysicalActivity
help: Any bodily activity that enhances or maintains physical fitness and overall health and wellness. Includes activity that is part of daily living and routine, structured exercise, and exercise prescribed as part of a medical treatment or recovery plan.

name: ContactPoint
help: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

name: Barcode
help: An image of a visual machine-readable code such as a barcode or QR code.

name: BroadcastService
help: A delivery service through which content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.

name: DatedMoneySpecification
help: A DatedMoneySpecification represents monetary values with optional start and end dates. For example, this could represent an employee's salary over a specific period of time. __Note:__ This type has been superseded by [[MonetaryAmount]] use of that type is recommended

name: OnDemandEvent
help: A publication event e.g. catch-up TV or radio podcast, during which a program is available on-demand.

name: ArtGallery
help: An art gallery.

name: OrderItem
help: An order item is a line of an order. It includes the quantity and shipping details of a bought offer.

name: HowToSupply
help: A supply consumed when performing the instructions for how to achieve a result.

name: ShoppingCenter
help: A shopping center or mall.

name: PsychologicalTreatment
help: A process of care relying upon counseling, dialogue and communication  aimed at improving a mental health condition without use of drugs.

name: OrderStatus
help: Enumerated status values for Order.

name: GiveAction
help:
The act of transferring ownership of an object to a destination. Reciprocal of TakeAction.

Related actions:

* [[TakeAction]]: Reciprocal of GiveAction.
* [[SendAction]]: Unlike SendAction, GiveAction implies that ownership is being transferred (e.g. I may send my laptop to you, but that doesn't mean I'm giving it to you).

name: ResearchOrganization
help: A Research Organization (e.g. scientific institute, research company).

name: EndorsementRating
help:
An EndorsementRating is a rating that expresses some level of endorsement, for example inclusion in a "critic's pick" blog, a
"Like" or "+1" on a social network. It can be considered the [[result]] of an [[EndorseAction]] in which the [[object]] of the action is rated positively by
some [[agent]]. As is common elsewhere in schema.org, it is sometimes more useful to describe the results of such an action without explicitly describing the [[Action]].

An [[EndorsementRating]] may be part of a numeric scale or organized system, but this is not required: having an explicit type for indicating a positive,
endorsement rating is particularly useful in the absence of numeric scales as it helps consumers understand that the rating is broadly positive.

name: RiverBodyOfWater
help: A river (for example, the broad majestic Shannon).

name: TouristInformationCenter
help: A tourist information center.

name: BookFormatType
help: The publication format of the book.

name: HousePainter
help: A house painting service.

name: TextDigitalDocument
help: A file composed primarily of text.

name: DislikeAction
help: The act of expressing a negative sentiment about the object. An agent dislikes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

name: VoteAction
help: The act of expressing a preference from a fixed/finite/structured set of choices/options.

name: PawnShop
help: A shop that will buy, or lend money against the security of, personal possessions.

name: OrganizeAction
help: The act of manipulating/administering/supervising/controlling one or more objects.

name: LegislationObject
help: A specific object or file containing a Legislation. Note that the same Legislation can be published in multiple files. For example, a digitally signed PDF, a plain PDF and an HTML version.

name: OfferItemCondition
help: A list of possible conditions for the item.

name: RealEstateListing
help:
A [[RealEstateListing]] is a listing that describes one or more real-estate [[Offer]]s (whose [[businessFunction]] is typically to lease out, or to sell).
  The [[RealEstateListing]] type itself represents the overall listing, as manifested in some [[WebPage]].

name: HowToItem
help: An item used as either a tool or supply when performing the instructions for how to to achieve a result.

name: MedicalOrganization
help: A medical organization (physical or not), such as hospital, institution or clinic.

name: MedicalTherapy
help: Any medical intervention designed to prevent, treat, and cure human diseases and medical conditions, including both curative and palliative therapies. Medical therapies are typically processes of care relying upon pharmacotherapy, behavioral therapy, supportive therapy (with fluid or nutrition for example), or detoxification (e.g. hemodialysis) aimed at improving or preventing a health condition.

name: EducationalAudience
help: An EducationalAudience.

name: PriceComponentTypeEnumeration
help: Enumerates different price components that together make up the total price for an offered product.

name: SizeSpecification
help: Size related properties of a product, typically a size code ([[name]]) and optionally a [[sizeSystem]], [[sizeGroup]], and product measurements ([[hasMeasurement]]). In addition, the intended audience can be defined through [[suggestedAge]], [[suggestedGender]], and suggested body measurements ([[suggestedMeasurement]]).

name: Chapter
help: One of the sections into which a book is divided. A chapter usually has a section number or a name.

name: EventVenue
help: An event venue.

name: PublicSwimmingPool
help: A public swimming pool.

name: ContactPage
help: Web page type: Contact page.

name: VideoObjectSnapshot
help: A specific and exact (byte-for-byte) version of a [[VideoObject]]. Two byte-for-byte identical files, for the purposes of this type, considered identical. If they have different embedded metadata the files will differ. Different external facts about the files, e.g. creator or dateCreated that aren't represented in their actual content, do not affect this notion of identity.

name: VirtualLocation
help: An online or virtual location for attending events. For example, one may attend an online seminar or educational event. While a virtual location may be used as the location of an event, virtual locations should not be confused with physical locations in the real world.

name: Pond
help: A pond.

name: ActionStatusType
help: The status of an Action.

name: UserCheckins
help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

name: EmailMessage
help: An email message.

name: PeopleAudience
help: A set of characteristics belonging to people, e.g. who compose an item's target audience.

name: Audience
help: Intended audience for an item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

name: LifestyleModification
help: A process of care involving exercise, changes to diet, fitness routines, and other lifestyle changes aimed at improving a health condition.

name: SeaBodyOfWater
help: A sea (for example, the Caspian sea).

name: AutoDealer
help: An car dealership.

name: LoanOrCredit
help: A financial product for the loaning of an amount of money, or line of credit, under agreed terms and charges.

name: HealthInsurancePlan
help: A US-style health insurance plan, including PPOs, EPOs, and HMOs.

name: USNonprofitType
help: USNonprofitType: Non-profit organization type originating from the United States.

name: House
help: A house is a building or structure that has the ability to be occupied for habitation by humans or other creatures (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House).

name: CollegeOrUniversity
help: A college, university, or other third-level educational institution.

name: ResumeAction
help: The act of resuming a device or application which was formerly paused (e.g. resume music playback or resume a timer).

name: CheckAction
help: An agent inspects, determines, investigates, inquires, or examines an object's accuracy, quality, condition, or state.

name: Article
help: An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

name: StatisticalPopulation
help:
A StatisticalPopulation is a set of instances of a certain given type that satisfy some set of constraints. The property [[populationType]] is used to specify the type. Any property that can be used on instances of that type can appear on the statistical population. For example, a [[StatisticalPopulation]] representing all [[Person]]s with a [[homeLocation]] of East Podunk California, would be described by applying the appropriate [[homeLocation]] and [[populationType]] properties to a [[StatisticalPopulation]] item that stands for that set of people.
The properties [[numConstraints]] and [[constrainingProperty]] are used to specify which of the populations properties are used to specify the population. Note that the sense of "population" used here is the general sense of a statistical
population, and does not imply that the population consists of people. For example, a [[populationType]] of [[Event]] or [[NewsArticle]] could be used. See also [[Observation]], and the [data and datasets](/docs/data-and-datasets.html) overview for more details.

name: State
help: A state or province of a country.

name: PodcastEpisode
help: A single episode of a podcast series.

name: UserLikes
help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

name: WPAdBlock
help: An advertising section of the page.

name: TouristDestination
help:
A tourist destination. In principle any [[Place]] can be a [[TouristDestination]] from a [[City]], Region or [[Country]] to an [[AmusementPark]] or [[Hotel]]. This Type can be used on its own to describe a general [[TouristDestination]], or be used as an [[additionalType]] to add tourist relevant properties to any other [[Place]].  A [[TouristDestination]] is defined as a [[Place]] that contains, or is colocated with, one or more [[TouristAttraction]]s, often linked by a similar theme or interest to a particular [[touristType]]. The [UNWTO](http://www2.unwto.org/) defines Destination (main destination of a tourism trip) as the place visited that is central to the decision to take the trip.
  (See examples below).

name: Beach
help: Beach.

name: MedicalTrialDesign
help: Design models for medical trials. Enumerated type.

name: TrainStation
help: A train station.

name: LakeBodyOfWater
help: A lake (for example, Lake Pontrachain).

name: CampingPitch
help:
A [[CampingPitch]] is an individual place for overnight stay in the outdoors, typically being part of a larger camping site, or [[Campground]].\n\n
In British English a campsite, or campground, is an area, usually divided into a number of pitches, where people can camp overnight using tents or camper vans or caravans; this British English use of the word is synonymous with the American English expression campground. In American English the term campsite generally means an area where an individual, family, group, or military unit can pitch a tent or park a camper; a campground may contain many campsites.
(Source: Wikipedia see [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite)).\n\n
See also the dedicated [document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations](/docs/hotels.html).

name: Place
help: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

name: TieAction
help: The act of reaching a draw in a competitive activity.

name: GeneralContractor
help: A general contractor.

name: MedicalRiskScore
help: A simple system that adds up the number of risk factors to yield a score that is associated with prognosis, e.g. CHAD score, TIMI risk score.

name: PreOrderAction
help: An agent orders a (not yet released) object/product/service to be delivered/sent.

name: NoteDigitalDocument
help: A file containing a note, primarily for the author.

name: CssSelectorType
help: Text representing a CSS selector.

name: WarrantyScope
help:
A range of of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Labor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-PickUp

name: BoardingPolicyType
help: A type of boarding policy used by an airline.

name: PodcastSeries
help: A podcast is an episodic series of digital audio or video files which a user can download and listen to.

name: Property
help: A property, used to indicate attributes and relationships of some Thing; equivalent to rdf:Property.

name: PublicToilet
help: A public toilet is a room or small building containing one or more toilets (and possibly also urinals) which is available for use by the general public, or by customers or employees of certain businesses.

name: MedicalAudience
help: Target audiences for medical web pages.

name: BroadcastChannel
help: A unique instance of a BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

name: ReplyAction
help:
The act of responding to a question/message asked/sent by the object. Related to [[AskAction]]

Related actions:

* [[AskAction]]: Appears generally as an origin of a ReplyAction.

name: VisualArtwork
help: A work of art that is primarily visual in character.

name: ConvenienceStore
help: A convenience store.

name: UserPageVisits
help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

name: GovernmentBenefitsType
help: GovernmentBenefitsType enumerates several kinds of government benefits to support the COVID-19 situation. Note that this structure may not capture all benefits offered.

name: OutletStore
help: An outlet store.

name: VideoObject
help: A video file.

name: ReplaceAction
help: The act of editing a recipient by replacing an old object with a new object.

name: AutomatedTeller
help: ATM/cash machine.

name: ApplyAction
help:
The act of registering to an organization/service without the guarantee to receive it.

Related actions:

* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, ApplyAction has no guarantees that the application will be accepted.

name: MusicGroup
help: A musical group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a choir. Can also be a solo musician.

name: ItemPage
help: A page devoted to a single item, such as a particular product or hotel.

name: HardwareStore
help: A hardware store.

name: MedicalRiskCalculator
help: A complex mathematical calculation requiring an online calculator, used to assess prognosis. Note: use the url property of Thing to record any URLs for online calculators.

name: Locksmith
help: A locksmith.

name: ReservationStatusType
help: Enumerated status values for Reservation.

name: AudioObjectSnapshot
help: A specific and exact (byte-for-byte) version of an [[AudioObject]]. Two byte-for-byte identical files, for the purposes of this type, considered identical. If they have different embedded metadata the files will differ. Different external facts about the files, e.g. creator or dateCreated that aren't represented in their actual content, do not affect this notion of identity.

name: SeekToAction
help: This is the [[Action]] of navigating to a specific [[startOffset]] timestamp within a [[VideoObject]], typically represented with a URL template structure.

name: MedicalGuidelineRecommendation
help: A guideline recommendation that is regarded as efficacious and where quality of the data supporting the recommendation is sound.

name: HealthAndBeautyBusiness
help: Health and beauty.

name: TattooParlor
help: A tattoo parlor.

name: DonateAction
help: The act of providing goods, services, or money without compensation, often for philanthropic reasons.

name: Guide
help: [[Guide]] is a page or article that recommend specific products or services, or aspects of a thing for a user to consider. A [[Guide]] may represent a Buying Guide and detail aspects of products or services for a user to consider. A [[Guide]] may represent a Product Guide and recommend specific products or services. A [[Guide]] may represent a Ranked List and recommend specific products or services with ranking.

name: AddAction
help: The act of editing by adding an object to a collection.

name: BoatTerminal
help: A terminal for boats, ships, and other water vessels.

name: MedicalProcedure
help: A process of care used in either a diagnostic, therapeutic, preventive or palliative capacity that relies on invasive (surgical), non-invasive, or other techniques.

name: DigitalDocument
help: An electronic file or document.

name: Intangible
help: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.

name: MedicalGuideline
help: Any recommendation made by a standard society (e.g. ACC/AHA) or consensus statement that denotes how to diagnose and treat a particular condition. Note: this type should be used to tag the actual guideline recommendation; if the guideline recommendation occurs in a larger scholarly article, use MedicalScholarlyArticle to tag the overall article, not this type. Note also: the organization making the recommendation should be captured in the recognizingAuthority base property of MedicalEntity.

name: AudioObject
help: An audio file.

name: IndividualProduct
help: A single, identifiable product instance (e.g. a laptop with a particular serial number).

name: MotorizedBicycle
help: A motorized bicycle is a bicycle with an attached motor used to power the vehicle, or to assist with pedaling.

name: ItemAvailability
help: A list of possible product availability options.

name: SocialMediaPosting
help: A post to a social media platform, including blog posts, tweets, Facebook posts, etc.

name: AggregateOffer
help: When a single product is associated with multiple offers (for example, the same pair of shoes is offered by different merchants), then AggregateOffer can be used.\n\nNote: AggregateOffers are normally expected to associate multiple offers that all share the same defined [[businessFunction]] value, or default to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell if businessFunction is not explicitly defined.

name: Poster
help: A large, usually printed placard, bill, or announcement, often illustrated, that is posted to advertise or publicize something.

name: CourseInstance
help: An instance of a [[Course]] which is distinct from other instances because it is offered at a different time or location or through different media or modes of study or to a specific section of students.

name: EducationEvent
help: Event type: Education event.

name: BedType
help: A type of bed. This is used for indicating the bed or beds available in an accommodation.

name: CovidTestingFacility
help:
A CovidTestingFacility is a [[MedicalClinic]] where testing for the COVID-19 Coronavirus
      disease is available. If the facility is being made available from an established [[Pharmacy]], [[Hotel]], or other
      non-medical organization, multiple types can be listed. This makes it easier to re-use existing schema.org information
      about that place e.g. contact info, address, opening hours. Note that in an emergency, such information may not always be reliable.

name: SizeSystemEnumeration
help: Enumerates common size systems for different categories of products, for example "EN-13402" or "UK" for wearables or "Imperial" for screws.

name: FurnitureStore
help: A furniture store.

name: PodcastSeason
help: A single season of a podcast. Many podcasts do not break down into separate seasons. In that case, PodcastSeries should be used.

name: MedicalObservationalStudyDesign
help: Design models for observational medical studies. Enumerated type.

name: CDCPMDRecord
help:
A CDCPMDRecord is a data structure representing a record in a CDC tabular data format
      used for hospital data reporting. See [documentation](/docs/cdc-covid.html) for details, and the linked CDC materials for authoritative
      definitions used as the source here.

name: HobbyShop
help: A store that sells materials useful or necessary for various hobbies.

name: Mosque
help: A mosque.

name: PaintAction
help: The act of producing a painting, typically with paint and canvas as instruments.

name: Review
help: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

name: ReportedDoseSchedule
help: A patient-reported or observed dosing schedule for a drug or supplement.

name: MusicAlbumReleaseType
help: The kind of release which this album is: single, EP or album.

name: PropertyValueSpecification
help: A Property value specification.

name: ElectronicsStore
help: An electronics store.

name: Language
help: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in [BCP 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) can be used via the [[alternateName]] property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using [[ComputerLanguage]].

name: ReactAction
help: The act of responding instinctively and emotionally to an object, expressing a sentiment.

name: AccountingService
help: Accountancy business.\n\nAs a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

name: ExchangeRateSpecification
help: A structured value representing exchange rate.

name: PoliceStation
help: A police station.

name: ComputerLanguage
help: This type covers computer programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, as well as other language-like computer representations. Natural languages are best represented with the [[Language]] type.

name: DepartAction
help: The act of  departing from a place. An agent departs from an fromLocation for a destination, optionally with participants.

name: WebSite
help: A WebSite is a set of related web pages and other items typically served from a single web domain and accessible via URLs.

name: ShippingRateSettings
help: A ShippingRateSettings represents re-usable pieces of shipping information. It is designed for publication on an URL that may be referenced via the [[shippingSettingsLink]] property of an [[OfferShippingDetails]]. Several occurrences can be published, distinguished and matched (i.e. identified/referenced) by their different values for [[shippingLabel]].

name: EndorseAction
help: An agent approves/certifies/likes/supports/sanction an object.

name: WPFooter
help: The footer section of the page.

name: Patient
help: A patient is any person recipient of health care services.

name: FMRadioChannel
help: A radio channel that uses FM.

name: InvestmentOrDeposit
help: A type of financial product that typically requires the client to transfer funds to a financial service in return for potential beneficial financial return.

name: InsuranceAgency
help: An Insurance agency.

name: DanceGroup
help: A dance group—for example, the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater or Riverdance.

name: AutomotiveBusiness
help: Car repair, sales, or parts.

name: MedicalDevice
help: Any object used in a medical capacity, such as to diagnose or treat a patient.

name: DDxElement
help: An alternative, closely-related condition typically considered later in the differential diagnosis process along with the signs that are used to distinguish it.

name: TaxiStand
help: A taxi stand.

name: FloorPlan
help: A FloorPlan is an explicit representation of a collection of similar accommodations, allowing the provision of common information (room counts, sizes, layout diagrams) and offers for rental or sale. In typical use, some [[ApartmentComplex]] has an [[accommodationFloorPlan]] which is a [[FloorPlan]].  A FloorPlan is always in the context of a particular place, either a larger [[ApartmentComplex]] or a single [[Apartment]]. The visual/spatial aspects of a floor plan (i.e. room layout, [see wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Floor_plan)) can be indicated using [[image]].

name: InviteAction
help: The act of asking someone to attend an event. Reciprocal of RsvpAction.

name: EmployeeRole
help: A subclass of OrganizationRole used to describe employee relationships.

name: HealthPlanCostSharingSpecification
help: A description of costs to the patient under a given network or formulary.

name: MerchantReturnPolicySeasonalOverride
help: A seasonal override of a return policy, for example used for holidays.

name: HomeAndConstructionBusiness
help:
A construction business.

A HomeAndConstructionBusiness is a [[LocalBusiness]] that provides services around homes and buildings.

As a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

name: DeleteAction
help: The act of editing a recipient by removing one of its objects.

name: Attorney
help: Professional service: Attorney. \n\nThis type is deprecated - [[LegalService]] is more inclusive and less ambiguous.

name: MensClothingStore
help: A men's clothing store.

name: AutoWash
help: A car wash business.

name: ReceiveAction
help:
The act of physically/electronically taking delivery of an object that has been transferred from an origin to a destination. Reciprocal of SendAction.

Related actions:

* [[SendAction]]: The reciprocal of ReceiveAction.
* [[TakeAction]]: Unlike TakeAction, ReceiveAction does not imply that the ownership has been transfered (e.g. I can receive a package, but it does not mean the package is now mine).

name: Boolean
help: Boolean: True or False.

name: MovieSeries
help: A series of movies. Included movies can be indicated with the hasPart property.

name: LodgingReservation
help: A reservation for lodging at a hotel, motel, inn, etc.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

name: Invoice
help: A statement of the money due for goods or services; a bill.

name: SportingGoodsStore
help: A sporting goods store.

name: CafeOrCoffeeShop
help: A cafe or coffee shop.

name: ReservationPackage
help: A group of multiple reservations with common values for all sub-reservations.

name: GeoCircle
help:
A GeoCircle is a GeoShape representing a circular geographic area. As it is a GeoShape
          it provides the simple textual property 'circle', but also allows the combination of postalCode alongside geoRadius.
          The center of the circle can be indicated via the 'geoMidpoint' property, or more approximately using 'address', 'postalCode'.

name: Consortium
help: A Consortium is a membership [[Organization]] whose members are typically Organizations.

name: WarrantyPromise
help: A structured value representing the duration and scope of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

name: SocialEvent
help: Event type: Social event.

name: HighSchool
help: A high school.

name: Museum
help: A museum.

name: GeoShape
help: The geographic shape of a place. A GeoShape can be described using several properties whose values are based on latitude/longitude pairs. Either whitespace or commas can be used to separate latitude and longitude; whitespace should be used when writing a list of several such points.

name: Date
help: A date value in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

name: DoseSchedule
help: A specific dosing schedule for a drug or supplement.

name: BrokerageAccount
help: An account that allows an investor to deposit funds and place investment orders with a licensed broker or brokerage firm.

name: CheckoutPage
help: Web page type: Checkout page.

name: PublicationIssue
help: A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or publication volume, often numbered, usually containing a grouping of works such as articles.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

name: LoseAction
help: The act of being defeated in a competitive activity.

name: Comment
help: A comment on an item - for example, a comment on a blog post. The comment's content is expressed via the [[text]] property, and its topic via [[about]], properties shared with all CreativeWorks.

name: AnatomicalSystem
help: An anatomical system is a group of anatomical structures that work together to perform a certain task. Anatomical systems, such as organ systems, are one organizing principle of anatomy, and can includes circulatory, digestive, endocrine, integumentary, immune, lymphatic, muscular, nervous, reproductive, respiratory, skeletal, urinary, vestibular, and other systems.

name: SpreadsheetDigitalDocument
help: A spreadsheet file.

name: ToyStore
help: A toy store.

name: IgnoreAction
help: The act of intentionally disregarding the object. An agent ignores an object.

name: OfferCatalog
help: An OfferCatalog is an ItemList that contains related Offers and/or further OfferCatalogs that are offeredBy the same provider.

name: SubscribeAction
help:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates pushed to.

Related actions:

* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, SubscribeAction implies that the subscriber acts as a passive agent being constantly/actively pushed for updates.
* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
* [[JoinAction]]: Unlike JoinAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.

name: PathologyTest
help: A medical test performed by a laboratory that typically involves examination of a tissue sample by a pathologist.

name: BodyOfWater
help: A body of water, such as a sea, ocean, or lake.

name: Mountain
help: A mountain, like Mount Whitney or Mount Everest.

name: APIReference
help: Reference documentation for application programming interfaces (APIs).

name: LandmarksOrHistoricalBuildings
help: An historical landmark or building.

name: Diet
help: A strategy of regulating the intake of food to achieve or maintain a specific health-related goal.

name: CableOrSatelliteService
help: A service which provides access to media programming like TV or radio. Access may be via cable or satellite.

name: MedicalCondition
help: Any condition of the human body that affects the normal functioning of a person, whether physically or mentally. Includes diseases, injuries, disabilities, disorders, syndromes, etc.

name: BusStop
help: A bus stop.

name: Offer
help:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service â€” for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

Note: As the [[businessFunction]] property, which identifies the form of offer (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose), defaults to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell; an Offer without a defined businessFunction value can be assumed to be an offer to sell.

For [GTIN](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin)-related fields, see [Check Digit calculator](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/support/check_digit_calculator) and [validation guide](http://www.gs1us.org/resources/standards/gtin-validation-guide) from [GS1](http://www.gs1.org/).

name: Cemetery
help: A graveyard.

name: BusinessEvent
help: Event type: Business event.

name: CookAction
help: The act of producing/preparing food.

name: Recipe
help: A recipe. For dietary restrictions covered by the recipe, a few common restrictions are enumerated via [[suitableForDiet]]. The [[keywords]] property can also be used to add more detail.

name: AllocateAction
help: The act of organizing tasks/objects/events by associating resources to it.

name: MedicalGuidelineContraindication
help: A guideline contraindication that designates a process as harmful and where quality of the data supporting the contraindication is sound.

name: Menu
help: A structured representation of food or drink items available from a FoodEstablishment.

name: ElementarySchool
help: An elementary school.

name: ParentAudience
help: A set of characteristics describing parents, who can be interested in viewing some content.

name: Dataset
help: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.

name: Courthouse
help: A courthouse.

name: RadioSeason
help: Season dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

name: NLNonprofitType
help: NLNonprofitType: Non-profit organization type originating from the Netherlands.

name: AboutPage
help: Web page type: About page.

name: DrugStrength
help: A specific strength in which a medical drug is available in a specific country.

name: Aquarium
help: Aquarium.

name: Library
help: A library.

name: Taxi
help: A taxi.

name: CheckInAction
help:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their arrival by registering/confirming for a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check in) or at a place (e.g. hotel), possibly resulting in a result (boarding pass, etc).

Related actions:

* [[CheckOutAction]]: The antonym of CheckInAction.
* [[ArriveAction]]: Unlike ArriveAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service.
* [[ConfirmAction]]: Unlike ConfirmAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the *start* of a previously reserved service rather than its validity/existence.

name: MedicalClinic
help: A facility, often associated with a hospital or medical school, that is devoted to the specific diagnosis and/or healthcare. Previously limited to outpatients but with evolution it may be open to inpatients as well.

name: Artery
help: A type of blood vessel that specifically carries blood away from the heart.

name: InteractAction
help: The act of interacting with another person or organization.

name: Conversation
help: One or more messages between organizations or people on a particular topic. Individual messages can be linked to the conversation with isPartOf or hasPart properties.

name: InvestmentFund
help: A company or fund that gathers capital from a number of investors to create a pool of money that is then re-invested into stocks, bonds and other assets.

name: AdvertiserContentArticle
help: An [[Article]] that an external entity has paid to place or to produce to its specifications. Includes [advertorials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advertorial), sponsored content, native advertising and other paid content.

name: Answer
help: An answer offered to a question; perhaps correct, perhaps opinionated or wrong.

name: MedicalEvidenceLevel
help: Level of evidence for a medical guideline. Enumerated type.

name: DietarySupplement
help: A product taken by mouth that contains a dietary ingredient intended to supplement the diet. Dietary ingredients may include vitamins, minerals, herbs or other botanicals, amino acids, and substances such as enzymes, organ tissues, glandulars and metabolites.

name: Role
help: Represents additional information about a relationship or property. For example a Role can be used to say that a 'member' role linking some SportsTeam to a player occurred during a particular time period. Or that a Person's 'actor' role in a Movie was for some particular characterName. Such properties can be attached to a Role entity, which is then associated with the main entities using ordinary properties like 'member' or 'actor'.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/06/introducing-role.html).

name: TechArticle
help: A technical article - Example: How-to (task) topics, step-by-step, procedural troubleshooting, specifications, etc.

name: Corporation
help: Organization: A business corporation.

name: GovernmentOrganization
help: A governmental organization or agency.

name: BroadcastEvent
help: An over the air or online broadcast event.

name: Service
help: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

name: Canal
help: A canal, like the Panama Canal.

name: OpeningHoursSpecification
help:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.


The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

name: LinkRole
help: A Role that represents a Web link e.g. as expressed via the 'url' property. Its linkRelationship property can indicate URL-based and plain textual link types e.g. those in IANA link registry or others such as 'amphtml'. This structure provides a placeholder where details from HTML's link element can be represented outside of HTML, e.g. in JSON-LD feeds.

name: InstallAction
help: The act of installing an application.

name: BuyAction
help: The act of giving money to a seller in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent buys an object, product, or service from a seller for a price. Reciprocal of SellAction.

name: DriveWheelConfigurationValue
help: A value indicating which roadwheels will receive torque.

name: OceanBodyOfWater
help: An ocean (for example, the Pacific).

name: Bone
help: Rigid connective tissue that comprises up the skeletal structure of the human body.

name: SizeGroupEnumeration
help: Enumerates common size groups for various product categories.

name: ViewAction
help: The act of consuming static visual content.

name: DigitalDocumentPermission
help: A permission for a particular person or group to access a particular file.

name: ClaimReview
help: A fact-checking review of claims made (or reported) in some creative work (referenced via itemReviewed).

name: PerformanceRole
help: A PerformanceRole is a Role that some entity places with regard to a theatrical performance, e.g. in a Movie, TVSeries etc.

name: UnRegisterAction
help:
The act of un-registering from a service.

Related actions:

* [[RegisterAction]]: antonym of UnRegisterAction.
* [[LeaveAction]]: Unlike LeaveAction, UnRegisterAction implies that you are unregistering from a service you werer previously registered, rather than leaving a team/group of people.

name: HealthTopicContent
help: [[HealthTopicContent]] is [[WebContent]] that is about some aspect of a health topic, e.g. a condition, its symptoms or treatments. Such content may be comprised of several parts or sections and use different types of media. Multiple instances of [[WebContent]] (and hence [[HealthTopicContent]]) can be related using [[hasPart]] / [[isPartOf]] where there is some kind of content hierarchy, and their content described with [[about]] and [[mentions]] e.g. building upon the existing [[MedicalCondition]] vocabulary.

name: OrderAction
help: An agent orders an object/product/service to be delivered/sent.

name: Class
help: A class, also often called a 'Type'; equivalent to rdfs:Class.

name: Integer
help: Data type: Integer.

name: Float
help: Data type: Floating number.

name: QualitativeValue
help: A predefined value for a product characteristic, e.g. the power cord plug type 'US' or the garment sizes 'S', 'M', 'L', and 'XL'.

name: ReadAction
help: The act of consuming written content.

name: SportsTeam
help: Organization: Sports team.

name: SearchResultsPage
help: Web page type: Search results page.

name: Journal
help: A publication in any medium issued in successive parts bearing numerical or chronological designations and intended, such as a magazine, scholarly journal, or newspaper to continue indefinitely.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

name: CategoryCode
help: A Category Code.

name: WriteAction
help: The act of authoring written creative content.

name: PerformAction
help: The act of participating in performance arts.

name: Trip
help: A trip or journey. An itinerary of visits to one or more places.

name: SportsClub
help: A sports club.

name: WebAPI
help: An application programming interface accessible over Web/Internet technologies.

name: HomeGoodsStore
help: A home goods store.

name: EatAction
help: The act of swallowing solid objects.

name: Hotel
help:
A hotel is an establishment that provides lodging paid on a short-term basis (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hotel).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

name: MoneyTransfer
help: The act of transferring money from one place to another place. This may occur electronically or physically.

name: Code
help: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

name: ImagingTest
help: Any medical imaging modality typically used for diagnostic purposes.

name: Map
help: A map.

name: Play
help: A play is a form of literature, usually consisting of dialogue between characters, intended for theatrical performance rather than just reading. Note: A performance of a Play would be a [[TheaterEvent]] or [[BroadcastEvent]] - the *Play* being the [[workPerformed]].

name: FoodService
help: A food service, like breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

name: GovernmentPermit
help: A permit issued by a government agency.

name: OfferForPurchase
help:
An [[OfferForPurchase]] in Schema.org represents an [[Offer]] to sell something, i.e. an [[Offer]] whose
  [[businessFunction]] is [sell](http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.). See [Good Relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GoodRelations) for
  background on the underlying concepts.

name: CriticReview
help: A [[CriticReview]] is a more specialized form of Review written or published by a source that is recognized for its reviewing activities. These can include online columns, travel and food guides, TV and radio shows, blogs and other independent Web sites. [[CriticReview]]s are typically more in-depth and professionally written. For simpler, casually written user/visitor/viewer/customer reviews, it is more appropriate to use the [[UserReview]] type. Review aggregator sites such as Metacritic already separate out the site's user reviews from selected critic reviews that originate from third-party sources.

name: Reservoir
help: A reservoir of water, typically an artificially created lake, like the Lake Kariba reservoir.

name: MeasurementTypeEnumeration
help: Enumeration of common measurement types (or dimensions), for example "chest" for a person, "inseam" for pants, "gauge" for screws, or "wheel" for bicycles.

name: MedicalImagingTechnique
help: Any medical imaging modality typically used for diagnostic purposes. Enumerated type.

name: HealthPlanFormulary
help: For a given health insurance plan, the specification for costs and coverage of prescription drugs.

name: FollowAction
help:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates polled from.

Related actions:

* [[BefriendAction]]: Unlike BefriendAction, FollowAction implies that the connection is *not* necessarily reciprocal.
* [[SubscribeAction]]: Unlike SubscribeAction, FollowAction implies that the follower acts as an active agent constantly/actively polling for updates.
* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
* [[JoinAction]]: Unlike JoinAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in getting updates from the object.
* [[TrackAction]]: Unlike TrackAction, FollowAction refers to the polling of updates of all aspects of animate objects rather than the location of inanimate objects (e.g. you track a package, but you don't follow it).

name: TouristTrip
help:
A tourist trip. A created itinerary of visits to one or more places of interest ([[TouristAttraction]]/[[TouristDestination]]) often linked by a similar theme, geographic area, or interest to a particular [[touristType]]. The [UNWTO](http://www2.unwto.org/) defines tourism trip as the Trip taken by visitors.
  (See examples below).

name: TVEpisode
help: A TV episode which can be part of a series or season.

name: Waterfall
help: A waterfall, like Niagara.

name: MovingCompany
help: A moving company.

name: ApartmentComplex
help: Residence type: Apartment complex.

name: Vessel
help: A component of the human body circulatory system comprised of an intricate network of hollow tubes that transport blood throughout the entire body.

name: Florist
help: A florist.

name: MaximumDoseSchedule
help: The maximum dosing schedule considered safe for a drug or supplement as recommended by an authority or by the drug/supplement's manufacturer. Capture the recommending authority in the recognizingAuthority property of MedicalEntity.

name: MovieTheater
help: A movie theater.

name: PlaceOfWorship
help: Place of worship, such as a church, synagogue, or mosque.

name: TelevisionChannel
help: A unique instance of a television BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

name: EntryPoint
help: An entry point, within some Web-based protocol.

name: PreventionIndication
help: An indication for preventing an underlying condition, symptom, etc.

name: GolfCourse
help: A golf course.

name: BusinessFunction
help:
The business function specifies the type of activity or access (i.e., the bundle of rights) offered by the organization or business person through the offer. Typical are sell, rental or lease, maintenance or repair, manufacture / produce, recycle / dispose, engineering / construction, or installation. Proprietary specifications of access rights are also instances of this class.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ConstructionInstallation
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Dispose
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#LeaseOut
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Maintain
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ProvideService
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Repair
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Buy

name: Schedule
help:
A schedule defines a repeating time period used to describe a regularly occurring [[Event]]. At a minimum a schedule will specify [[repeatFrequency]] which describes the interval between occurences of the event. Additional information can be provided to specify the schedule more precisely.
      This includes identifying the day(s) of the week or month when the recurring event will take place, in addition to its start and end time. Schedules may also
      have start and end dates to indicate when they are active, e.g. to define a limited calendar of events.

name: Volcano
help: A volcano, like Fuji san.

name: AchieveAction
help: The act of accomplishing something via previous efforts. It is an instantaneous action rather than an ongoing process.

name: DeliveryEvent
help: An event involving the delivery of an item.

name: HowToStep
help: A step in the instructions for how to achieve a result. It is an ordered list with HowToDirection and/or HowToTip items.

name: UserDownloads
help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

name: RsvpAction
help: The act of notifying an event organizer as to whether you expect to attend the event.

name: MonetaryAmount
help: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between Â£1,000 and Â£1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

name: NailSalon
help: A nail salon.

name: Church
help: A church.

name: Gene
help: A discrete unit of inheritance which affects one or more biological traits (Source: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene)). Examples include FOXP2 (Forkhead box protein P2), SCARNA21 (small Cajal body-specific RNA 21), A- (agouti genotype).

name: ParcelDelivery
help: The delivery of a parcel either via the postal service or a commercial service.

name: ImageObjectSnapshot
help: A specific and exact (byte-for-byte) version of an [[ImageObject]]. Two byte-for-byte identical files, for the purposes of this type, considered identical. If they have different embedded metadata (e.g. XMP, EXIF) the files will differ. Different external facts about the files, e.g. creator or dateCreated that aren't represented in their actual content, do not affect this notion of identity.

name: LibrarySystem
help: A [[LibrarySystem]] is a collaborative system amongst several libraries.

name: PaymentChargeSpecification
help: The costs of settling the payment using a particular payment method.

name: SportsEvent
help: Event type: Sports event.

name: ReserveAction
help:
Reserving a concrete object.

Related actions:

* [[ScheduleAction]]: Unlike ScheduleAction, ReserveAction reserves concrete objects (e.g. a table, a hotel) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

name: Playground
help: A playground.

name: Casino
help: A casino.

name: GameServer
help: Server that provides game interaction in a multiplayer game.

name: GatedResidenceCommunity
help: Residence type: Gated community.

name: Seat
help: Used to describe a seat, such as a reserved seat in an event reservation.

name: CreativeWorkSeries
help:
A CreativeWorkSeries in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. CreativeWorkSeries are usually organized into some order, often chronological. Unlike [[ItemList]] which is a general purpose data structure for lists of things, the emphasis with CreativeWorkSeries is on published materials (written e.g. books and periodicals, or media such as tv, radio and games).

Specific subtypes are available for describing [[TVSeries]], [[RadioSeries]], [[MovieSeries]], [[BookSeries]], [[Periodical]] and [[VideoGameSeries]]. In each case, the [[hasPart]] / [[isPartOf]] properties can be used to relate the CreativeWorkSeries to its parts. The general CreativeWorkSeries type serves largely just to organize these more specific and practical subtypes.

It is common for properties applicable to an item from the series to be usefully applied to the containing group. Schema.org attempts to anticipate some of these cases, but publishers should be free to apply properties of the series parts to the series as a whole wherever they seem appropriate.

name: CreativeWorkSeason
help: A media season e.g. tv, radio, video game etc.

name: ComedyEvent
help: Event type: Comedy event.

name: GovernmentService
help: A service provided by a government organization, e.g. food stamps, veterans benefits, etc.

name: Project
help:
An enterprise (potentially individual but typically collaborative), planned to achieve a particular aim.
Use properties from [[Organization]], [[subOrganization]]/[[parentOrganization]] to indicate project sub-structures.

name: Bridge
help: A bridge.

name: ListItem
help: An list item, e.g. a step in a checklist or how-to description.

name: Landform
help: A landform or physical feature.  Landform elements include mountains, plains, lakes, rivers, seascape and oceanic waterbody interface features such as bays, peninsulas, seas and so forth, including sub-aqueous terrain features such as submersed mountain ranges, volcanoes, and the great ocean basins.

name: Text
help: Data type: Text.

name: PhysicalActivityCategory
help: Categories of physical activity, organized by physiologic classification.

name: UserComments
help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

name: PhotographAction
help: The act of capturing still images of objects using a camera.

name: OfficeEquipmentStore
help: An office equipment store.

name: ProductCollection
help: A set of products (either [[ProductGroup]]s or specific variants) that are listed together e.g. in an [[Offer]].

name: ActivateAction
help: The act of starting or activating a device or application (e.g. starting a timer or turning on a flashlight).

name: CompoundPriceSpecification
help: A compound price specification is one that bundles multiple prices that all apply in combination for different dimensions of consumption. Use the name property of the attached unit price specification for indicating the dimension of a price component (e.g. "electricity" or "final cleaning").

name: 3DModel
help:
A 3D model represents some kind of 3D content, which may have [[encoding]]s in one or more [[MediaObject]]s. Many 3D formats are available (e.g. see [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:3D_graphics_file_formats)); specific encoding formats can be represented using the [[encodingFormat]] property applied to the relevant [[MediaObject]]. For the
case of a single file published after Zip compression, the convention of appending '+zip' to the [[encodingFormat]] can be used. Geospatial, AR/VR, artistic/animation, gaming, engineering and scientific content can all be represented using [[3DModel]].

name: MedicalTrial
help: A medical trial is a type of medical study that uses scientific process used to compare the safety and efficacy of medical therapies or medical procedures. In general, medical trials are controlled and subjects are allocated at random to the different treatment and/or control groups.

name: DataFeed
help: A single feed providing structured information about one or more entities or topics.

name: RepositoryCollection
help: A Collection is a group of resources. Collections have descriptive metadata, access metadata, and may links to works and/or collections. By default, member works and collections are an

name: RepositoryObject
help: An Object is an intellectual entity, sometimes called a "work", "digital object", etc. Objects have descriptive metadata, access metadata, may contain files and other Objects as member "components". Each level of a work is therefore represented by an Object instance, and is capable of standing on its own, being linked to from Collections and other Objects. Member Objects can be ordered using the ORE Proxy class.
